solution.text:
Draw a line QS of length \(_{k}_\,cm\).
We know, the diagonals of a rhombus are perpendicular bisectors of each other.
Construct its perpendicular bisector and let them meet at O.
Cut of \(_{{j/Decimal(2)}}_\,cm\) lengths on either side of the drawn bisector.
You now get P and R.
Complete the rhombus by joining the points P, Q, R and S.
The length of each side in a rhombus is equal.
Measure the length of side PQ using a ruler as \(_{{trunc((((j/Decimal(2))**2+(k/Decimal(2))**2)**(1/Decimal(2))),2)}}_\,cm\)

content.text: Construct a rhombus PQRS where diagonal PR is \(_{j}_\,cm\) and diagonal QS is \(_{k}_\,cm\). Using a ruler, measure the length of the side of the rhombus. What is the length of the side?
